metadata.title: Journal Pre-proofs Free DNA, a reason for severe COVID-19 infection? Free DNA, a reason for severe COVID-19 infection?

location.addrLine: Baoan Maternal and Child 8 Health 9 Hospital

body_text.text: MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 is also thought derived from bat coronaviruses. However, 20 it is not pathogenic for bat at all, because free DNA in cytoplasm or blood cannot 21 bring up violent immune response in bat; but it can produce severe inflammations in 22 human. I hypothesized that the damage induced by free DNA is a reason for severe 23 COVID-19, which can explain many symptoms of this disease, such as cytokine 24 storm, ARDS and muscus plug, acute injuries of heart, liver and kidney, and some 25 special symptoms of COVID-19. My hypothesis will be helpful for better understand 26 the etiology of severe COVID-19. cytokines, 5,6 thus risk for "cytokine storm". In addition to these cytokines, free DNA 56 can also destroy vascular endothelial cells directly: 7 in vitro study showed it can harm 57 human umbilical vein endothelial cells. The damage of endothelial cells will boost the 58 dysfunctions of multiple organs by cytokine storm, as described as follow. 59 Meanwhile, cytokine storm will also promote the permeability of blood vessels. Level 60 of lymphocytes is thought as the early identification of risk factors for severe 61 COVID-19, [1] [2] [3] 8 while I hypothesized that it was related to free DNA-related cytokine 62 storm and blood vessel damage, which can explain many symptoms of this disease, 63 including some "special" symptoms in COVID-19, as shown in Figure 1 . have no fever at admission to hospital, but most of them will develop a fever during 143 hospital. 2 I thought that the "delayed fever" was partly due to an increasing level of 144 free DNA, in addition to the amplification of the virus. Third, many clinicians found 145 that some severe COVID-19 patients have experienced two or more "attack" even 146 after viral load was reduced. I thought that some attack was due to direct invasion by No research support for this manuscript.

FIGREF0.text: COVID-19) has a bad clinical outcome, and some reports emphasized the 17 role of cytokine storm and dysfunctions of multiple organs. However, the etiology of 18 severe COVID-19 has been largely unknown. Similar as SARS-CoV and 19

FIGREF1.text: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 is also thought derived from 40 bat coronaviruses. 4 However, all these coronaviruses, in addition to other human fatal 41 virus such as Ebola and Marburg, are not pathogenic for bat at all. One major reason 42 is that free DNA in cytoplasm or blood cannot bring up violent immune response in 43 bat. However free DNA can produce severe inflammations in human mediated by 44 KLRC/KLRD family of natural killer cell receptors, MHC class I genes, and type I 45interferons, and some DNA sensors, 5,6 thus "cytokine storm" in human. Therefore, I 46 hypothesized that the damage induced by free DNA is a reason for severe COVID-19.

FIGREF2.text: DNA is produced by dying cells. In healthy subjects, white blood cells are the 50 major source of free DNA. While in cancer, it is usually from tumor cells. Free DNA 51 In COVID-19 patients can be brought up by both injured lung cells, lymphocytes, and 52 other immune cells. More than 60% of COVID-19 patients had lymphopenia, 1-3 which 53 produced abundant free DNA in these patients. Free DNA is then circulated into 54 many tissues and activated various tissue cells to produce a large amount of 4 55

FIGREF3.text: 64Other immune cells can also be the source of free DNA. For example, the 65 alveolar macrophages are significantly increased, filled, and activated in the alveolar66    cavities in the COVID-19 patients with ARDS, 9 which can produce a large amount of 67 free DNA and cytokines. In addition, the neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs), an68    important pathogenic components of neutrophils, also have a large amount of free69    DNA, myeloperoxidase-DNA complexes, histones, and enzymes. The level of NETs 70 was reported contributed to lung injury and was correlated with severity of some risk factors for severe COVID-19, such as hypertension, diabetes, 75 cardiovascular diseases, 1-3 all of which have previous vascular damages. I thought that 76 the blood vessels in these patients are more vulnerable for free DNA-induced damage, 77 then these patients have more chances to be admitted to the ICU and death. Moreover,78    above underlying diseases are also risk factors for severe SARS, which also showed 79 some characteristics of "cytokine storm".11 80 Some clinical outcomes of severe COVID-19 can be explained by free 81 DNA-induced damage. Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is a major cause 82 of death, which can be developed from interstitial pneumonia commonly found in , while with fewer invasion of SARS-CoV-2 compared to 87 SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV. 13 ARDS is commonly seen in sever COVID-19 patients 88 because of the following reasons: first, lung has a large total area of capillary bed, 89 thus prone to vessels damage and cytokine storm induced by free DNA; second, 90 higher content of oxygen in lung vessels can form more 8-oxodG, the product of free 91 DNA, then brought up more serious harm to lung vessels; 6 third, SARS-CoV-2 92 directly invade into and destroy pulmonary epithelial cells by ACE2 receptor. 14 93 Sticky mucus plug in alveoli and bronchioles is a special feature of severe 94 COVID-19 patients. This is an important reason for poor prognosis of severe 95 COVID-19. In addition to a large cell debris produced by cytokine storm, I thought 96 that there were high content of free DNA in inflammatory exudationa in alveoli and 97 bronchioles, which is very sticky and is easy to bound to cell debris and fibrin, thus 98 the formation of mucus plug. 99 Compared to patients not in ICU, those in ICU have more higher prevalence of 100 shock, 1-3 which involves the dysfunction of microvascular endothelial cells and large 101 effusion of liquid from circulation into tissues. In addition, acute injuries of heart, 102 liver and kidney, where have abundant blood flow, was also prone to occur in these 103 severe COVID-19 patients. 1-3 SARS-CoV-2 were not extensively found in above 104 organs in severe COVID-19 patients by autopsy; meanwhile, there were obvious 105 damage of vessles, inflammation and edema of these organs. 13 Moreover, the increase 106 of vascular permeability will accelerate the damage of cytokines. Therefore, these 107 fatal complications in COVID-19 were caused at least partly by free DNA-induced 108 vessels' damage and cytokine storm, but not only by the virus itself. 109 Acute injuries of liver and kidney are also usually seen in severe SARS patients. 11 110 Taken together with cytokine storm, similar risk factors and complications in the 111 infections of both SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2, it implied that free-induced vascular autopsy of severe COVID-19 patients. Additionally, drowsiness and 116 convulsions can be seen in some children patients. These phenomena can also be 117 explained by free-DNA induced vessel damage and inflammation. 118 Once the vascular endothelial cells damaged, the coagulation system is activated. 119 Thrombocytopenia, higher Pro-thrombin time and D-dimer level are more common in 120 severe COVID-19 patients. 1-3 It implied that there were more severe damages of 121 vascular endothelial cells in severe patients compared to mild patients. Consistently, 122 there were some microthrombus in many organs and obvious hemorrage in lung found 123 by autopsy of severe patients. The microthrombus and hemorrage of above organs can 124 further disturb their functions. I want to compare COVID-19 to the infection of Ebola, 125 another fatal virus from bat, which also has immune suppression and a systemic 126 inflammatory response that causes impairment of the vascular and coagulation, 127 leading to severe hemorrhage, multiorgan failure and shock. 15 I thought that there also 128 is free DNA-induced vascular damage and inflammation in the infection of Ebola, 129 which usually cannot be compensated by coagulation system. 130 Free DNA is relative resistant to the endonuclease action, 16 so the free DNA from 131 both dead lung cells and lymphocytes can be accumulated in blood to a certain extent, 132 then induce the damage of COVID-19 patients rapidly and violently. It can explain 133 the following "strange" phenomenon: first, compared to SARS and MERS, patients 134with COVID-19 usually had a comparative long interval from disease onset to135    dyspnoea, but they were suddenly worsening and had some severe symptoms shortly,136    such as ARDS, admission to mechanical ventilation and to ICU. 1-3 Importantly, these 137 symptoms (averagely not before day 12 in non-surviors) 17 is usually happened when 138 the viral shedding is already decreasing (its peak time at about day 6) in severe 139 COVID-19 patients. It can be easily explained by the accumulation of free DNA in 140 blood. When it is extended to a "threshold", significant vessels damage and cytokine 7 141 storm will be produced. In addition, Guan et al reported that about half of patients 142

FIGREF4.text: 147 the virus, while the others might be due to the cytokine storm or vessel damage 148 induced by free DNA. Most surprisingly, some discharged patients with improved CT 149 results and continuous twice negative tests of nucleic acids, were found to return to 150 positive tests of nucleic acids . 18 It implied that the load of virus increased after they 151 were discharged from hospital. This phenomenon is not seen in SARS and MERS. 152 Free DNA is related to the continues activation and use up of immune cells. 19 I 153 thought that comparative high level of free DNA in some discharged patients will 154 eventually suppress immune function and cause the amplification of virus. 155 Lastly but not least, antiviral drugs usually are helpful in mild patients but not in 156 many severe patients, 1-3 because of free DNA-induced "cytokine storm" and vessel 157 damage. However, plasmapheresis may be an effective treatment, 11 at lest partly I thought that free DNA-induced damage play a pivotal role in the 162 etiology of cytokine storm in severe COVID-19. So free DNA might be a useful 163 biomarker of severe COVID-19. Further investigations of free DNAno competing interests.
